chapter.title: Key-Value Databases
chapter.session: 8.3.1. Storing Session Information Generally, every web session is unique and is assigned a unique sessionid value. Applications that store the sessionid on disk or in an RDBMS will greatly benefit from moving to a key-value store, since everything about the session can be stored by a single PUT request or retrieved using GET. This single-request operation makes it very fast, as everything about the session is stored in a single object. Solutions such as Memcached are used by many web applications, and Riak can be used when availability is important.
